nsr.notes: Converted from DOCX and enriched with additional context from prior chats. Some dates/locations inferred.

basics.name: John Lee
basics.label: Founder at Python AI Solutions
basics.summary: Data and open source software enthusiast with a background in Neuroscience. With a PhD in Neuroscience, I have spent more than a decade working in Data Science, DevOps, Software Engineering, and AI systems, primarily utilising Python. My goal is to leverage AI ethically to enhance data collection, processing, and interpretation in both corporate and governmental contexts.

work.name: Python AI Solutions Ltd.
work.summary: Consulting and product development in AI, data, and software; privacy-first, accessibility-first approach.
highlights: Built pipelines for extracting scientific transparency metrics from public sources.
Deployed a React web application and led frontend delivery with modern tooling.
Collaborated with NIH researchers on data workflows and reproducible pipelines.
Created and open-sourced 'No Strings Resume'—a privacy-first resume builder (no accounts, no tracking).

work.name: Quansight
work.summary: Engineering across the scientific Python ecosystem, web applications, and ML pipelines.
highlights: Improved CI systems for scikit-image and NumPy.
Developed an ML pipeline for time-series analysis.
Built web apps for social media and HR needs.
Created a UI for an AI chatbot.

work.name: National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH), NIH
work.summary: Working on the AFNI team, focusing on build/testing/packaging/CI/containerization/enabling cloud computing. Improved software distribution and reproducibility for a global scientific community.
highlights: Led Docker-based packaging and distribution for scientific pipelines.
Adopted NiPype and containerization best practices for HPC workflows.

work.name: Foundation for Advanced Education in the Sciences (FAES)
National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH), NIH
work.summary: Worked with various community software tools for downloading human neuroimaging datasets, releasing newly gathered ones into the wild, and executing analysis pipelines at scale in aid of extracting insight into mental health. Developed MRI data processing pipelines and applied advanced AI techniques.
highlights: Implemented variational autoencoders and Bayesian neural networks.
Explored federated learning for privacy-preserving analysis.

work.name: Virginia Hospital Center
work.summary: Assembled a hospital wide report for a national survey of performance metrics and salaries.

work.name: Trinity College Institute of Neuroscience (TCIN)
work.summary: Researched neural network changes in Drosophila using DSP, microscopy, and electrophysiology.

work.name: Trinity College Institute of Neuroscience (TCIN)
work.summary: Developed molecular techniques for assessing NFκB activity.

work.name: National Center for Biological Sciences (NCBS)
work.summary: Automated bacterial colony quantification using MATLAB.

projects.name: No Strings Resume
projects.description: Privacy-first, open-source resume builder with local-only data and multi-format export.
highlights: No account, no tracking, accessible by design
Exports: PDF, DOCX, JSON, HTML, HR-Open JSON

projects.name: Chronos HVAC app
projects.description: Frontend subcontracting, Terraform setup, hardware refactor, and frontend management.

projects.name: NIH Clinical-center MRI facility scheduler app deployment
projects.description: Reworked configuration management, added tests, containerized CI, and added security/auth.

projects.name: HR summary app
projects.description: Dashboard using prompt engineering to summarize HR survey results with ChatGPT.

projects.name: Center for Multimodal Neuroimaging website migration
projects.description: Reimplemented CMN site as a static website.

projects.name: PyTorch-Ignite contributions
projects.description: Improved pytest failure recovery and refactored API for deprecations/backwards compatibility.

projects.name: Justice Innovation Lab
projects.description: Guided improvements in Dagster pipelines, cloud infra, and data management.

projects.name: Neurodevelopmental & Behavioral Phenotyping Service
projects.description: Reviewed open-source solutions for radiological reports and guided clinical pipeline processes.

projects.name: Open Science Metrics pipeline
projects.description: Pipeline to populate MongoDB with open science metrics; deployed a Panel app.

projects.name: ETL pipeline & JS prototype app
projects.description: Managed external contractor, integrated with Open Science Metrics project.

publications.name: Age dependent volume estimation biases in recon-all clinical and recon-any
publications.summary: Project examining age-related biases between FreeSurfer ‘recon-all -clinical’ and ‘recon-all -any’. Contributors include Dylan M. Nielson, John Anthony Lee, Eric Earl, Dustin Moraczewski, and Francisco Pereira.

publications.name: Knowing what you know in brain segmentation using Bayesian deep neural networks
publications.summary: Applied Bayesian methods to improve uncertainty quantification in brain segmentation

publications.name: AFNI Makes Group Templates Quickly & Easily! (make_template_dask.py)
publications.summary: OHBM 2019 poster co-authored with Daniel Glen, Robert W. Cox, and Paul A. Taylor, demonstrating Dask-parallelized AFNI group template building.

publications.name: Distributed Weight Consolidation: A Brain Segmentation Case Study
publications.summary: Explored continual learning approaches for medical image segmentation

publications.name: Detecting and harmonizing scanner differences in the ABCD study - annual release 1.0
publications.summary: Preprint on scanner-induced variance and harmonization in ABCD; authors include Dylan M. Nielson, John A. Lee, Adam G. Thomas, and colleagues. DOI: 10.1101/309260

publications.name: NIMH NHGRI data-sharing project (NNDSP) dataset
publications.summary: Dataset release of 441 high-resolution T1-weighted scans from 321 families; investigators include Philip Shaw, John A. Lee, Nino Migineishvili, Dylan Nielson, and others.

publications.name: Parsimony and Machine Learning in Neuroimaging
publications.summary: Study exploring parsimony vs. model complexity in neuroimaging prediction; contributors include Nino Migineishvili, Dylan Nielson, Adam G. Thomas, et al.

publications.name: Olfactory habituation in Drosophila - odor encoding and its plasticity in the antennal lobe
publications.summary: Research on odor encoding and plasticity in neural circuits

publications.name: Plasticity of local GABAergic interneurons drives olfactory habituation
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
publications.summary: Co-author: Investigated role of GABAergic interneurons in olfactory learning and memory

publications.name: The Ataxin-2 protein is required for microRNA function and synapse-specific long-term olfactory habituation
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
publications.summary: Co-author: Explored molecular mechanisms underlying long-term memory formation
